intro: Erysimum aurantiacum, commonly known as the orange wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. Its vibrant orange flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soils.
